body:
Thanks Pete, it just sounded like a lot of people were saying that they use
it and that it's useful and only a few don't and want to remove it. I
agree, it should work well, and provided the functionality was replicated
elsewhere, I see no problem in removing it from here. I agree with you that
moving it into STI makes more sense.

A good quality guide to STI is a good idea. I've always found myself
browsing often conflicting opinions on how to implement STI with relation
 to controllers and views. A good guide should also help drive development
of STI in the future in an agreed upon direction?



On Thu, Aug 2, 2012 at 10:38 AM, Pete B <
reply@reply.github.com
> wrote:

> @brendon From what I can see, no one is saying they want to remove it
> because they don't use it. However, leaving flawed features in the
> framework doesn't benefit anyone in the long term. Removing it and
> providing something more consistent either within Rails or a separate gem
> is not a difficult task.
>
> Regarding the documentation, someone a few months ago tried to provide an
> [official guide to STI](https://github.com/lifo/docrails/pull/100) and
> maybe it makes sense to bring this back to life.
>
